snippet: The Obama and Romney campaigns are using the personal information of voters to, in effect, train people to go to the polls through subtle cues, rewards and threats.
abstract: Strategists affiliated with Obama and Romney campaigns say they have access to information about personal lives of voters at a scale never before imagined, which they are using to try to influence voting habits; even as campaigns embrace ability to know so much more about voters, they recognize risks associated with intruding into lives of people who have long expected that privacy of the voting booth extends to their homes.
lead_paragraph: The Obama and Romney campaigns are using the personal information of voters to, in effect, train people to go to the polls through subtle cues, rewards and threats.

headline.main: Campaigns Mine Personal Lives to Get Out Vote
headline.print_headline: Campaigns Mine Personal Lives To Get Out Vote
